title: Chicken Jalfrezi

ingredients.content: 450 g chicken breasts, skinless, cut in pieces (3 cm)
400 g tinned chopped tomatoes (1 x 400 g tin)

preparations.content: Place a bowl on mixing bowl lid and weigh in chicken. Remove bowl from lid, add ground coriander, cumin and turmeric then stir well. Cover with cling film and set aside in fridge to marinate while making tomato sauce.
Place oil, onions, garlic and green chilli in mixing bowl then chop <b>5 sec/speed 5<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula then sauté <b>5 min/120°C/speed <b>.

Add tomatoes, water, ground coriander, cumin, turmeric and salt then blend <b>30 sec/speed 8<b>. Scrape down sides and lid of mixing bowl with spatula then simmer <b>15 min/98°C/speed 0.5<b>. Transfer to a bowl and set aside. Rinse mixing bowl.
Place oil and onions in mixing bowl then chop <b>2 sec/speed 5<b>.
Add diced peppers and chillies then cook <b>10 min/100°C//speed <b>.
Add marinated chicken and reserved tomato sauce then cook <b>15 min/100°C//speed <b>. Stir in garam masala and chopped coriander leaves then serve with pilau rice or Indian bread.

hintsAndTricks: The chicken can be left to marinate overnight for an even greater depth of flavour.

A traditional jalfrezi involves frying the meat (‘frezi’ means stir-fry), but the results are just as impressive and healthier when prepared in your Thermomix. In the days of the Raj, Bengali chefs often cooked this dish using leftover cooked meat or poultry. Just as delicious prepared as a vegetable curry, too.
